intro: Miquelia thorelii, commonly known as the Chinese mallow, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its fibrous stems and hairy leaves are notable botanical features.
